creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: garden scene: large garden pond in foreground with island and trees; reflections of garden trees and landscape in pond; pavilions, trees, shrubs, and blooming trees in background; three white swans in pond at LLC; self-published
marks: L margin, printed: 自摺　昭和八年作　庭四題　春之朝 {jizuri, Shōwa signed LRC, in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida | signed LR
medium: Woodblock print; ink and colors on paper
title: A Garden in Okayama on a Spring Morning
